availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Seth Bradshaw and Sarah Bradshaw. Married to Sallie Ann Wilson Bradshaw in Adair County, Kentucky, on April 4, 1862. Father of Bettie C. Bradshaw and Mary G. Bradshaw. Farmer in Adair County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Adair County in 1850. Clerk in Russell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 71B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 765.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 52A-52B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, p. 240..
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Second District, p. 28.
Find A Grave, "Timoleon Bradshaw (1833-1906)," Memorial #88640018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88640018 (accessed May 18, 2020).
